N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 3.37 - Executive Order No. 37: [Directing that the Chief of Staff order into active service the organized militia to assist authorities in guaranteeing public safety and protecting property in certain counties.]
State Regulations
I, HUGH L. CAREY, by virtue of authority vested in me as

Governor, under the Military Law of the State, do hereby direct by Executive

Order that the Chief of Staff to the Governor order into the active service of
the State, for such period, to such extent, and in such manner as he may deem
necessary, all or any part of the organized militia to assist authorities in
guaranteeing the public health and safety and in the protection of public and
private property in the counties of Kings, Nassau, New York, Queens, Rockland, Suffolk, Westchester and the Metropolitan area of New York City and other areas
where assistance may be required. (1)

Major General Vito J. Castellano, Chief of Staff to the Governor, is hereby
appointed commander of all personnel ordered into active service of the State
in this emergency. (2)

Units and
members of the organized militia to be designated by order of the Chief of

Staff to the Governor will immediately assemble at their local armories when
and where ordered by the Chief of Staff to the Governor and will remain
assembled pending further orders as to their disposition by the Chief of Staff
to the Governor. (3)

All
enlistments, reenlistments, or voluntary extension of enlistments which expire
after 9 August 1976 and during the period for which the members are currently
ordered into the active service of the State are hereby extended for the
duration of such duty in the active service of the State. Signed: Hugh L. Carey

Dated: August 9, 1976
